name: Enterprise ATT&CK Matrix
description: TTPs identified in Citrine Sleet's Operation Blacksmith

techniques.comment: The threat actor conducts extensive reconnaissance of the cryptocurrency industry and individuals associated with it.

The threat actor creates fake websites masquerading as legitimate cryptocurrency trading platforms and uses them to distribute fake job applications or lure targets into downloading a weaponized cryptocurrency wallet or trading application based on legitimate applications.
The group is known to specifically target Windows-based systems.
The primary method of rootkit delivery is via a spearphishing link.
The rootkit deploys primarily as a driver but also spreads its activity to user-mode binaries to enhance persistence.
The rootkit modifies system registry settings to establish persistence.
The group employed the rootkit to evade detection by endpoint protection tools.
The threat actor uses standard application layer protocols to establish command and control channels.
The group generates fraudulent financial transactions to appease victim financial systems.
